Reviews.Title: Great Television or Computer Monitor!
Reviews.Author: William E. Beavers Jr.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television as a computer monitor.  I wanted it because of the LCD backlight, built in speakers, and large screen, for a computer monitor.  When I purchased it my computer had not yet been built so I hooked it up to my cable box and WOW what a great picture!  Granted I was coming from an old CRT television but hey this thing was very impressive!  It is very customizable and can be set on preset settings as well.  It worked great to replace a 1981 circa Magnavox in my bedroom.  I used it for a couple of weeks as a television and when my computer came in I switched it to a computer monitor.  I had purchased an HDMI cable from AMAZON before my computer arrived.  Plugged in the HDMI cable and the power and keyboard and wal-la the picture came on with the sound!  No need to configure the system to set up, it just works!  Right out of the box.  Being an informed consumer I had read that you need to calibrate the screen.  Well when the monitor first came on I understood why.  Things seemed a little blurry.  I set the Veiwsonic to Computer and it helped but this was not yet the solution.  I then found in Windows 7 the clear type set up under the control panel and displays.  Once you configure to clear type this thing looks great!  It is like reading on a piece of paper!  Screens and videos look great!  I am running Windows 7 64-bit professional.  The high resolution high definition screen is very impressive!  For me the price was right because I have a computer monitor that can be a television if I want as well.  It has three HDMI connections so I can connect another computer, maybe a Mac Mini in the future, and later maybe an X-box 360!  You can easily switch with the touch sensitive controls or use the remote.  The colors and contrast are really incredible.  This television/monitor is a great deal for the money!  I caught mine at a good time to purchase because I got it for about twenty-five dollars under three-hundred dollars!  If you read these reviews often you will know why I wrote it like that.  It runs cool, comes on after a 5 second Viewsonic warm up screen, switches between sources easily, looks great and works like it is supposed to!  In short I like this monitor a lot!To me it rivals the Apple LED Cinema Display.  Notice I said rivals not as good as or surpasses!  This television is great!  It works as a monitor wonderfully!  Part of the reason I purchased it is due to the fact that I wanted built in speakers and an HDMI connection.  I did not want to have a video cable, power cord, speakers, speaker wire, and another power cord for the speakers forming a web on my desk.  This set up is clean and simple.  HDMI cable to the back of the computer to the monitor, then everything works.  One power cord for the monitor and one for the computer. Simple!  I compared it to the Apple Cinema Display because I was thinking of using one of these to connect to my PC.  Unfortunately you would need to by the Apple Mini Display video connector to HDMI conversion plug and pray that it would work.  I could never get assurances that you could get PC drivers for the camera and I did not find anyone that said that it worked when they connected to a PC.  Oh and also to buy the Apple you would need to cough up three times the money!  I know the Apple display is IPS has a glass screen (the Viewsonic has the plasticky laptop screen) and a built in video camera.  Still this does not make it worth nearly a thousand dollars!  I do wish that Viewsonic would place a glass screen on this television; it would move it up in class, and admittedly in cost.  I wish they would install a camera on the top of the screen, a good one, like the new ones from Logitech!  Then they would have a true Apple competitor!  When I looked around for a large screen, LED backlight, High definition monitor, with multiple HDMI connections, and built in speakers the Viewsonic television is the only one I could find this affordably.  This is the only monitor, or television, that came close to the Apple Display, and after purchasing it and using it as both a television and a monitor, I feel that it has lived up to its printed specifications and my expectations!  Buy one I think you will agree!One more thing; I purchased this through Amazon along with another item through J&R; Audio.  I had to return the other item after purchasing it.  I could not have had a better experience from the folks at J&R; Music.  They were kind, helpful, and did everything they said that they would do and even faster than they said they would do it.  It is rare these days to find a company that under promises and over delivers and I feel these folks did.  I am always leery of ordering from a reseller and these folks gave me confidence!

Reviews.Title: Perfect small tv
Reviews.Author: BM
Reviews.Content: I got this tv for my apartment bedroom at college, and it is great. Easily hooked up to my computer to watch movies, gets great hd local channels with an antenna.I would give it 5 stars, but the speakers don't sound that good. They are on the back, and therefore project sound backwards, but the tv has a headphone out, and was very easy to plug in some computer speakers that sound better.The remote has really handy buttons, including a cc on/off shortcut, and a channel list button, which shows available hd antenna channels in a handy on screen menu.The tv also looks amazing, very sleek.I love it :)

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, menus are wanting, sound as previously reported is terrible.
Reviews.Author: John C. O. Donnell "Eclectophile"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to use as a secondary monitor and TV in my bedroom rather than have 2 screens cluttering it up.  I chose this one because it's an LED and the reviews were fairly promising.  So far I'm happy with the purchase but not blown away.  It does what I want it to do, for the most part.The first one I received worked brilliantly for the first day, then I turned it on the 2nd morning and it just cycled through the channel list without actually stopping or showing anything.  I was pretty disappointed but Amazon made it easy to return.  I printed up my label, the UPS guy showed up with a second box, I gave him my return box, and I was up and running again in about a week.  Not too bad I suppose.One observation.  I'm very supportive of Amazon wanting to be a green company but I really think that part of the reason my first TV had an issue is because they shipped the TV in the box it came in without any additional packaging.  So it got to me relatively banged up.  The second TV, still working after 2 weeks, came in a box with a hole punched in it.  Not promising.  The issue is that the box, as packaged is not sealed, it just has one of those foldy flap things in the center and if someone wanted to they could have easily gotten into the box and taken anything they wanted and there would have been zero evidence of tampering.  Spend a couple bucks guys, put these things in TV's with some bubble packing and spare yourself the returns.Picture.  The picture on this TV is actually pretty impressive.  Not as good as the 23" Samsung LEDTV that I was originally looking at but definitely a very good picture with vibrant, but not surreal colors.  Straight out of the box the backlight is set at 50 percent and this is adequate for most rooms.  I use it in a room with a substantial amount of light in the day so I have mine set at 60 percent and it is very viewable.  Off axis viewing is acceptable from side to side and when viewed from above, when viewed from any kind of angle from below it's next to worthless.  I had it on a stand on my desk originally and an angle of as little as 30 degrees and you get that picture fade that makes it look like you're looking through a polarizing filter.  As long as you keep this in mind I think this TV is good for 90 percent of applications.Sound:  Sound quality is tinny and insufficient.  I knew this going into this unit.  I had a 2.0 set of computer speakers that I set up on either side of the TV, used the headphone output, and just cranked the volume on the computer speakers to max.  I can use my remote to control the volume, no problem, and it sounds great.Menus.  Menus are typical not great.  OSD is lacking and the type is much to small if you're any distance from the TV.  I like to watch TV in bed when going to bed and you can't read the type letting you know what's on and there's no option to increase the size of the type.  One thing that is really handy, since I don't have cable, is that when you hit the info button, it tells you the relative signal strength.  One thing that is terrible, unlike most HDTV's, this TV has no program guide.  The channel list provides just that, the channel list with station IDs.  When you hit on info you can find out what you're watching, but there's no way to look ahead to see what's going to be on any of the channels that are programmed in.  Even the old Sylvania ATSC tuner I bought 5 years ago has this ability.  Poor choices Viewsonic.  Channel changing takes a second or 2.  Leads me to suspect that they put in a less powerful CPU to control this TV, but it gets the job done and aside from losing the signal it hasn't frozen up or played audio that was out of synch yet.Remote is acceptable and does not need to be pointed directly at the TV.  All the frequently used buttons are immediately available and it only took a day or so to know where all the functions I wanted were by feel.  No complaints.  Touch controls on the TV itself are relatively sensitive and I have had no issues thus far.All in all I'd say that bang for your buck this is a very competent TV/monitor.  There are very few choices in this size that have all of the features that this one does.  Picture in picture would have been nice.  I would have like putting TV in the upper corner of the screen while using the rest of the screen as a desktop extension, but that's a little much to expect for 250 bucks.  the form factor is very nice and thin.  Not a fan of the silver base but that's just my personal preference.I would recommend this monitor based on the quality of the picture but realize that it has limitations.  Neither of the 2 that I received from Amazon had dead pixels so that speaks to the quality of the screen manufacturing at least.  A good choice for someone wanting the picture quality of an LED but not wanting to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: Nice HDTV but still need some optimizations
Reviews.Author: F. De Maio
Reviews.Content: This review is for ViewSonic VT2300LED 23-Inch 1920x1080p LED LCD HDTV with Built-in HDTV Tuner, Black. Bought it from amazon at an unbeatable price, but super saver shipping took much more than a whole week to deliver.First let me say that this is a goog looking HDTV. It will catch the eye if standing on any desk. But in my honest opinion, it has two real defects that can be a deal breaker, so be aware.PROSNice Looking TVVery Light and thin.Plenty of inputs and outputs for the everyday use.VERY NICE AS A MONITOR (HDMI-DVI cable is the best choice)Easy to use and set up (assembly and setting up took less than 5 minutes including analog and digital channels from my local cable company)Space saver and versatile (I use it as a monitor for my bedroom desk and as TV at night)CONSFirst is the audio issue. This TV sounds like my grandfather's old transistor radio. There's no sign of low frecuencies and no matter how much tweaking you can do, you will end with a mid-hi tone that can be very annoying to some people like me. I hooked up a pair of good external speakers and problem solved!.Then is the angle-of-view issue. Horizontal view is almost perfect, but there is a mild loss of if you change your vertical angle of vision. So every time I want to watch TV from a point lower than my desk (like the bed), I have to tilt it down a bit in order to get the details of darker scenes instead of shadows.Start up time is around 5 seconds.Nevertheless I'm happy with my purchase. 4 stars rating for HDTV and shipping speed, but full 5 stars as a monitor.

Reviews.Title: splendid monitor if viewer is seated directly in front of it
Reviews.Author: briarsmith
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent monitor if you use the TV as a computer and sit directly in front of it with the screen at eye level. Looking down on the screen or from the side, the picture loses color and appears distorted.  The tv has a weak sound system.

Reviews.Title: Great Value and Outstanding picture quality
Reviews.Author: JLM
Reviews.Content: Bought the Viewsonic 23" for use in my travel trailer mostly because it was a 1080 with an anti-glare screen and the very low power draw of less than 30 watts.  I have been extremely impressed with the picture quality and the sound is OK (considering the small size of the speakers) as long as the SRS Trusurround feature is NOT used (this makes it sound very tinny).  The clarity of the picture is very good and the resolution is extremely good.  There are many video inputs available to be able to connect nearly any type of device that you might wish to use.  The remote operates as expected and the buttons are fairly well laid out.  Considering the low price through Amazon of less than $250 shipped, this TV is an exceptional value for a LED LCD that is 1080p capable.  I would highly reccommed this to anyone that will use in a medium to smaller sized room, and might end up using a set of computer speakers to make the sound a better quality.

Reviews.Title: Great tv, great price!
Reviews.Author: D. S. Coffey "K9MomOf6"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item to replace one of the "old school", clunker tv's I still had in my house. It was the best price online, and the picture is very nice. Shipping was also very fast from the vendor. The only thing we did not like was that it was not packed inside a box for protection and privacy -- it arrived in its original brand box and left on my doorstep by UPS! We were just glad our UPS guy hid it from view; otherwise, anyone could have just walked by, seen it, and taken it home and we would have not been the wiser.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, but horrible PC monitor
Reviews.Author: Shimon Pozin "Shimon"
Reviews.Content: I was truly deceived by great reviews at this website. When I received the monitor and started reading it carefully, I realized why. Check it out: people who use this device as TV are very satisfied. People who try to use it as PC monitor have attitude "whatever, it's ok. I  can live with it" If you think about this as computer monitor, don't!!! It is not. The picture is horrible even after adjustments. It fails all calibration tests. You can adjust settings to make it average, but that's the most you can get. It cannot and should not be used as computer monitor. Nice little TV for small size root (I guess students and rental apartments are targeted here), but as computer monitor it is horrible as many of the reviewers have mentioned. Text is not crisp. If you don't work with documents or read from computer monitor, you may be ok with it. Otherwise, skip this item.It's just nice little TV. Not more than that.

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic VT2300LED-Not quite ready for Prime Time
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a Viewsonic TV/Monitor before and was very pleased with it. When it came time to send my son off to college so too went the television. So I read the positive reviews about this set. The Sound as with most small TV's is lacking. No problem plug a set of computer speakers into the headphone jack and all is well. The picture is fine. Now for the downside. We purchased the set on August 23 and now the unit won't come on unless unplugged and then replugged. Off for waranty after only 60 days. We will either get a refurb unit or repair and expect it to take 3 weeks for the turnaround.

Reviews.Title: Awesome as a PC monitor
Reviews.Author: vmathew
Reviews.Content: So someone here said this works well as a TV and not as a Monitor. I'd like to disagree; maybe they had an outdated video card.I have a Dell Vostro 1310 laptop (3years old) and I bought this as an external display to convert the laptop into a Desktop. Picture quality is awesome, I get full 1920x1080 resolution display just using a plain old VGA cable. Great sharpness of image, absolutely no picture flaws that I can see (and I'm not a person who has low standards).I haven't tested the sound on it, but I wouldn't expect much since the speakers are on the back and look small. But the TV has a headphone jack and so one could buy their own set of speakers and plug it into the TV.I haven't used this as a TV yet. (just got the product 5 days ago, and I need to get an antennae). But I guess there's ample reviews here saying it works great as a TV. Just wanted to write this review since someone gave a rather convincing sounding review that the product is no good as a Monitor, and that had gotten me worried but I decided to take a gamble and am happy that I did; Therefore I wanted to let others in a similar situation know that I bought this primarily to use as a monitor, and it works amazingly great as a monitor, in spite of whatever written here stating otherwise./matt (2011 August 5th)===== Update August 7th, 2011 ======Again I shouldn't have believed all those people here who're the kind that buy a toyota pick up truck to haul a 52 foot trailer. For the size of the TV, the speakers are great - provides good sound in my bedroom even when the sound it left at a fourth of as high as it can get. I should have tested the speakers before believing the reviews and ordering an external speaker set -- now I have to sell that off when it comes. But yes, contrary to what anyone else says, the sound is great.Got a cheap antenna and tested the TV functionality out. HD channels look awesome on this TV. The older format channels look fine but not great; I guess it would be the case on any fullHD TV though - you're comparing that against the HD quality for one, and they don't have the resolution for your TV for the other.On other fronts, the TV stand that comes with it doesn't allow rotation on the vertical axes, but allows rotation on the horizontal axes - which is fine since you could just reposition the whole thing if you wanted to rotate on the vertical axes. I was really worried since I need a TV that can be tilted up/forward and down/backward since i need it primarily as a monitor - so happy on that front too. Assembly and use was a cakewalk, really happy about how user-friendly this is. I also liked the options on the remote.It also has a cool feature that if it's on computer input, and if I turn off the computer, the TV would turn off after 10 seconds. While this is expected, the cool thing is that, when I next turn on the computer, I don't have to turn on the TV again, it will sense the computer input becoming active and turn itself on. So basically great for a power-conscious but lazy person.

Reviews.Title: Mind of its own
Reviews.Author: Joy Day
Reviews.Content: Got this as a replacement to a 25 year old sony. Installed easy and I like the look of it. Picture is great and the sound is just fine. Went to watch it and within a half hour, it started doing things on its own - it would mute itself, it would change its input... I checked the remote and no one was touching it. I even took out the batteries, but the tv still did things on its own. The most annoying was that it would show the pop up screen for input and just cycle through the input types. cycling... cycling.... finally it would choose one and switch all by itself. I would have to pause the dvr until I could get it to stop cycling and change back to the tv signal. It did that three times in a 20 minute period. very strange. It's going back! my old sony is already back in place!

Reviews.Title: Better TV than monitor
Reviews.Author: M. Yu
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as an external monitor for my laptop with a minimum of cable clutter.  I was looking for an LED monitor with decent speakers, HDMI, 1080p and a TV tuner - this is pretty much the only item that fits the bill, plus the price is right.PROS: Inexpensive, relatively loud speakers (for built-in ones), HDMI, bright display, HD tuner, good video playback.CONS: No bass in speakers, text is hard to read (not crisp), limited color controls, color saturation could be better.SUMMARY: While I don't love the monitor, the price was right and it does a decent job of meeting all my criteria.  For a few bucks more, you could probably get a better TV and you could definitely get a better monitor with external speakers. Ergo, features are great, performance is merely decent.

Reviews.Title: This is an awesome monitor for $250
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This is such a step up from my previous Dell 17" monitor. I use it for PC and the PS3. The response time is 5ms, better than my 8ms HDTV I had for the PS3. I can tell it is a little faster. I can't wait to play Crysis and FEAR on it. I bought this over a typical PC monitor because I needed the extra inputs. The only problem is that the speakers are tinny, but that's what why you can attach a set of PC speakers.Overall: 5 out of 5!

Reviews.Title: Displayed Picture Aspect Does Not Track Input
Reviews.Author: KAYO
Reviews.Content: This TV is fine as far as picture quality, however it suffers from a serious design flaw if using the ATSC Tuner. Incredibly, the displayed aspect ratio does not automatically track the program content. Specifically, off-air HD programs (16x9) require manual selection of "FULL" while off-air std-def (4x3) programs require manual selection of "NORMAL." Failure to manually select these settings to match the program aspect will mean a distorted picture.If you are going to use this TV only as a computer monitor or are feeding it from, say, DirecTV or Cable box this will probably not be an issue for you, because (at lease with my DTV HD boxes) aspect is controlled by the set top box. Using the internal ATSC Tuner for off-air, however, you will probably find this design flaw unacceptable.I called ViewSonic support for help on this and there was none. They acknowledged the problem but have no solution. Also, there is no apparent way for the user to update the firmware, assuming they ever do decide to correct this problem. There is no ethernet port and no mention of the possibility of future firmware updates on their site.I ended up returning the set to Amazon. ViewSonic really screwed the pooch on this tuner issue. This TV is NOT ready for prime time, unless you'll never use the built-in tuner. Otherwise, it makes a nice little monitor with great picture.

Reviews.Title: Good for TV/XBOX/Droid, poor PC monitor
Reviews.Author: Bright Technologies
Reviews.Content: As a TV it is good especially for price. Great color, OK sound, lots of inputs. As a PC monitor- problems. With PC on PC-VGA input, only a few resolutions are available and Windows does not recognize monitor type or native resolutions even after loading driver/descriptor. With PC on HDMI input, the display has 1" black border around picture that means it's scaling so if you set it for 1680x1050 or (TV) 1080p or any other resolution, it's not really using that but scaling the display down to a smaller area so appearance is poor quality. The problem occurs with two different video cards, ATI and nVidea, with Windows 7 Pro. Tech support was polite but had no one technical available to talk to and never called back. Other info: Power cord plugs straight into back and sticks out perpendicular so may have trouble mounting in some narrow situations. Input ports for computer are (3) HDMI and (1) PC VGA but no DVI.

Reviews.Title: very good tv
Reviews.Author: CHUCKLEBERRY
Reviews.Content: just got my tv and all i can say is WOW. viewsonic made on heck of a led lcd tv well worth the money

Reviews.Title: Mostly good, viewing angle not so great
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I'm mostly happy with this TV, my one gripe about it is the viewing angle is not the best. The picture starts to suffer pretty quickly as you deviate from being head-on to the TV and level with it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice HDTV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Kristen E. Bogren "Kristen Bogren"
Reviews.Content: This TV is extremely easy to set up Only takes one piece to attach to bottom, and batteries in the remote. Once it was done auto tuning to my cable box, I was up and running!  The sound is good, but wish it was a little louder. Overall for the price, I am extremely happy with this purchase. Also its not hooked up to my HD Cable box, just a digital box through comcast but the picture is still awesome.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV
Reviews.Author: Jackson "Ragtopdad"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to replace a 23" Samsung LCD TV in our kitchen because the picture has never been really sharp.  I read a number of reviews that said that  this Viewsonic had a "fabulous" picture. So I bought it and connected it to my Direct TV cable (non-HD receiver).  The picture is sharper than the Samsung, but not as sharp as "fabulous" would imply.  I have adjusted it with all of the controls that are available and the picture is "decent".  I had less objection to the sound quality than many of the reviews.  I have not used it as a monitor, so I can not offer an opinion about that.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor and decent TV.
Reviews.Author: Solarx.110mb
Reviews.Content: This Viewsonic LED TV/Monitor does a great job as a computer monitor and is super sleek looking.  The base is nice and solid, I think it is aluminum.  The screen is super sharp even when not at the native resolution.  It adjusts to the computer resolution automatically.  This is a very efficient TV/Monitor.  I tested it with a kill-a-watt tester and it uses only 33 watts.  Strangely it stays at 33 watts no matter how low I set the brightness.  So you can adjust it to anything you like and the watts stay the same at 33.It is also pretty good as a TV.  I like how setting the screen to full will give you a full screen regardless of the channel.  I also like how it changes channels pretty fast.  I would say it is a better computer monitor than a TV, but it is a good TV also.  The sound is ok for me.  It is a good enough sound for a small TV.  Obviously if it were a big screen TV the expectations of sound would be greater, but for the size I am ok with it.  Unlike some reviewers, the sound levels are very flexible.  On level 1, I cannot even hear it.  Actually, at night a low level at 5-8 would be low enough not to bother anyone.  It gets loud too if you crank it, just not very much bass, even though I turned the bass all the way up on the settings.For a small TV/Computer Monitor, I think this cannot currently be beat.* Just a few things I forgot to mention= When changing the channel, the numbers showing the channel are so tiny, you literally have to get up and get within a few feet of the TV to see them.  I don't think it would have been very hard to make these numbers bigger.Also, because this TV is 60Mhz, there is some motion blur, but I figured it would have some and yet I still bought it because it is so efficient and sleek lookin.

Reviews.Title: good value-lots of connectivity options at this price
Reviews.Author: Spreitzer in Missouri
Reviews.Content: I received this monitor/TV as a christmas present from my husband.  It is on a mantle over a fireplace in a sitting room/study off our bedroom. This monitor/TV has lots of options for multiple uses. We have it connected to our satellite system, a network access DVD player, the grandkids game system, a USB mini-drive loaded with pictures, and my PC. It was easy to connect all these devices and the picture quality is excellent in all modes. Lots of options at this price level.

Reviews.Title: Dealing with View Sonic
Reviews.Author: Gardener
Reviews.Content: The TV was purchased based upon the remarks made by others which all seemed to give good reviews.  I have been working with the folks at View Sonic to have the sound reflect changes made in the Treble and Base sound bars without success.  I am sending it back for the second time just as soon as I receive a prepaid label from the manufacturer.  The first time I had to pay to have the set returned yet it was purchased less than a month ago when I initially began calling with the problem.  The set came back and there was no difference in the quality of the sound.  In addition to this problem, when the last of the three folks that did assist me, was obtaining my information as to the ownership of the set he had a name and address for a person in New Jersey.  I question if this is actually a new set as indicated!

Reviews.Title: poor design
Reviews.Author: Desticle
Reviews.Content: Had to return immediately due to poor power cord placement. Unfortunately the power cord attaches where the wall mount needs to go, so if you plan on mounting it on the wall look elsewhere.- updated -decided to keep TV and just get a mount that is absolutely no bigger than 100 x 100.I will update on how much I like or dislike later.

Reviews.Title: View Sonic Television
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV for my husband to replace an older model in the bedroom.  I chose View Sonic for two reasons: they have been making monitors for computers for a long time, and the price was right.  Delivery was as promised by Amazon (isn't it always?).  Set up was easy, and we have had no problems with the TV.  My husband is very happy with his gift, and when I asked if he had any "cons" about it, he had none.

Reviews.Title: Had to return it
Reviews.Author: J. Hahn "windsurfer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this HDTV for broadcast signals and had problems.  Both the channel list and favorite list would become corrupted within a few days of setting them up.  Some channels would be missing; others would be replicated.  I would have to set it all up again to fix it.  After the 3rd time, I decided it was not usable for me and had to return it.  One other issue I had was that I also used it as a PC monitor (via HDMI interface) and the unit did not go into standby when the screen blanked.  I don't believe there's any standby or auto power off feature which is kind of surprising these days, especially from a monitor manufacturer!

Reviews.Title: awesome hd tv, especially for ps3
Reviews.Author: tdanewman
Reviews.Content: Displays my ps3 in 1080p perfectly, and the hd channels look amazing. sound wasn't that great, but a good pair of relatively cheap speakers and sub combo (30 bucks) fixed it right up

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: yeager26
Reviews.Content: I had not heard of "ViewSonic", but took a chance. The TV has worked out great as a 1080p gaming TV for PS3, as well as a high-definition dual monitor for use with my Macbook.

Reviews.Title: Good TV & Monitor at a good price
Reviews.Author: W. Xu
Reviews.Content: Viewsonic is a very good brand (American company, headquarter in California) in computer monitor field, but not very famous on TV products.This TV is very slim and supports 1920 x 1080 resolution and 1080p full HD at only $260. It has 3 HDMI ports which make it be able to connect your PC, gaming console, hometheater suits and other HD output devices at the same time. Its picture is very nice compared to other TV at the same price, but honestly, it is not as good as Samsung, Sony and some other Japanese Brands. For a monitor, it performs great on video and game but not very well on text. Some previous reviews state its poor sound quailty and tiny volume, but I think it depends where you put/use it. I use it at college dorm and it works perfectly, its sound can be very loud if you turn the volume up to above 40%.  I believe it even fits for a very big living room if you turn up to 75% or above. The sound quailty is okay for a TV, after all it is only $260.

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic VT2300LED
Reviews.Author: tdf
Reviews.Content: Fabulous TV and computer monitor. The HDTV tuner gives you accesss to selected HD channels without the dreaded cable box. I took it out of the box, plugged it in, connected the cable and computer and it worked instantly. When using it as a computer monitor, one touch of any TV channel or the "channel up/down" button takes you right to the TV without changing the input source. Great device at a great price.

Reviews.Title: This is not designed to be a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I purchased the VT2300LED to replace a 7-year old 17-inch LCD monitor. I thought this would give me a normal computer screen with 1920x1080 resolution via the HDMI port. I didn't really need the TV, but didn't mind paying the extra $50 to get the tuner, which I could use occasionally to watch TV.As other reviewers have noted, the TV works OK, but the computer monitor is awful. Using the VGA port, it is much worse than my 7-year old monitor. Using the HDMI port, the quality is even worse and text becomes painful to read. I spent two days trying to change the configuration (monitor settings, video card settings, and Windows 7 settings) and while some improvements can be made, the display quality is never good enough to be used as a computer monitor. From a close distance, text always appears grainy and aliased. This problem can be reduced a bit by lowering the "sharpness" setting on the monitor, but then the text becomes blurry.The HDMI port clearly was not designed to be connected to a computer video card. The VGA port seems to be an afterthought and barely works. It is surprising that the digital port (HDMI) provides even worse quality than the analog port (VGA). If you need a monitor with which to read text, I do not recommend this product. If you are only going to look at moving video from a distance, the product is fine.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed... Defective.
Reviews.Author: C. Peterson
Reviews.Content: I received this unit just a couple of days ago and I have to say that I couldn't get the unit to stay on very long because there was a short or bad connection in the back of the unit where the power cord hooks into the power supply.  From what I could see I wasn't impressed with the clarity although the actual unit itself (without the unit turned on) looked impressive.  Since I was replacing my last ViewSonic (which only for an alternative brand altogether.

Reviews.Title: set99
Reviews.Author: set99
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television primarily to be used as a computer monitor. As a monitor the text was crisp, attractive and pleasing to the eyes. For viewing television you will need to have this hooked up to a HD source from your cable or broadband provider to see the HD aspects. I returned this to amazon because of the poor graphic (Viewsonic logo) on the front. Within two days of arrrival, I was cleaning the outside surface with a cloth specifically designed for monitors and tv's and the VIEWSONIC logo came off. I figured if the company cut corners on graphics what else were they shorcutting. I've used Viewsonic monitors in the past and was and still am pleased with their picture and text quality.

Reviews.Title: POOR customer service!
Reviews.Author: Jin Gong
Reviews.Content: OK TV but POOR customer service!I bought this TV from Amazon three years ago and it has been an OK TV until last month it went dead. I called ViewSonic Customer Service about what I could do with it and I was told that they would charge at least $150 to repair it since it was out of warranty. I then asked if I could get a copu of the SERVICE Manual so that I might be able to fix it by myself with the manual. He said it was OK and send me a FTP link and a password for me to download the file. Unfortunately, the file was not on the FTP folder. I then called again, and after 10 mninutes on hold, I was told that they were not allowed to send a copy of Serivice Manual of a discontinued product to their customer. I don't understand why? This is ridiculous. Anyway, this would be the last ViewSonic product I buy.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!
Reviews.Author: R. C. H.
Reviews.Content: I use it as a tv and a computer monitor, and it's been great for almost 3 years now. Some people complained about graininess, but I've only noticed that when I'm trying to play a DVD upconverted to 1080p, which looks pretty awful. Otherwise, everything looks amazing. Great picture and digital audio from the tv to the stereo. The speakers on the tv itself are tinny and strangely facing the wall behind the tv, but despite their lack of quality I do find them useful sometimes, like late at night - it's nice to be able to hear the dialogue without the rumble of the subwoofer. All in all a great tv/monitor for a small living space.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Dual use monitor for the price.....
Reviews.Author: Moodaji
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd monitor I bought to add to my office desk and they are both connected to my Laptop.  The reason I bought this was due to its built-in HDTV Tuner, which allows me to sometime watch TV on one monitor while I continue working on my laptop using another monitor.  The picture quality is quite sharp and the sound is quite loud.  Another thing to note is that it comes with many Connection options.....in all I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic VT2300LED 23-Inch 1920x1080p LED LCD HDTV with Built-in HDTV
Reviews.Author: DAWGUIN
Reviews.Content: ViewSonic VT2300LED 23-Inch 1920x1080p LED LCD HDTV with Built-in HDTV; La calidad de este TV- MONITOR es impresionante, las imagenes son muy nitidas y complementandolas con un buen sistema surround.

Reviews.Title: Excellent monitor!
Reviews.Author: venichhe
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine helped me pick this out when I was purchasing a new computer from amazon. Very sharp pictures, I am very much satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: A true smal Full HD TV (and I love it!)
Reviews.Author: The Neurochild
Reviews.Content: Trust me when it tell you this TV is great... for small rooms!As My bedroom can't allow itself to harbor a big HDTV, i was looking for something small and to play my PS3 games in HD. I don't repent from buying this TV. But apart from stylish, it serves as your main TV... and your PC, even better with one of the 3 HDMI ports.It doesn't trick you with its featurea, be3cause its a true Full HD TV. Image quality is great and even better when playin a BD movie or a game with my console. Those who have also a PC with HDMI are also in for a treat. I have to confess I didn't test the VGA port with a TRS for sound (you know, the stereo plug, the one that looks like a headphone jack), but who cares when you have HDMI on your PC? Anyway image quality is great.The menus are OK in features, but serves their purpose. OSD is right, not pretty but not distracting.The sound is very good, even though its speakers are on the back, which I understand sound a little far. But it's even better with your phones plugged in. But one word of advice: the TruSRS Surround is weak! Quite ironic, isn't it?The only catch I found on this TV is its remote. I have to replace with another directly form ViewSonic because they seem a bit fragile, to the point that one day it fell off and then one of the number buttons remained (and still remains) stuck, making it impossible to work it right. Anyway, when you have it unbroken, it works great and lets you switch between inputs with ease.As I am well aware that small Full HD TV are quite rare these days, this one is worth the price of admission. Not perfect, but still a good value.

Reviews.Title: A TV should last longer than 1 year
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for me, my ViewSonic TV completely lost it's picture one year to the day I bought it. The picture has been great until today. The screen now has a black area over 95 % of the screen and it is a dead piece of junk as far as I'm concerned. I double checked everything but of course nothing has been changed or modified on the TV and my cable provider has no HD issues on any other of my TVs in the home. I'm venting but I went against my better judgement selecting a Viewsonic machine in the first place. There goes $250 down the drain. I'm amazed that companies in this day and age can build a TV that only lasts a year and then craps out and loses it's picture. Be forewarned.

Reviews.Title: One of the best models for the price
Reviews.Author: Adino
Reviews.Content: The quality is comparable to any of the major brands on the market. I am totally satisfied with this product. The best amazon purchase so far.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tv. Works very well as a small tv and monitor for a computer monitor. It is not the best computer monitor but for the price it excels. I mainly use it for my xbox, tv, and computer monitor and works great for all of the tasks. I have two problems though. The way it was packaged was not the best and when the ups man dropped it off he just left it on the side of the house. Something that expensive in my opinion should be made to sign for but thats just my opinion. The audio is a bit sharp such as the speakers dont have to much base but that is very easily fixed with some external speakers. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality, terrible speaker system
Reviews.Author: DAVID L TRUESDALE
Reviews.Content: Item received well protected.  The TV box was repackaged in a larger box with plenty of padding.  It was easy to set up.  I like the picture quality (after adjusting the brightness, the default setting washed everything out).  The only real issue I have is the sound quality.  It's very "tinny", no bass or depth to it.  I really recommend a set of quality speakers when you purchase this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great for gaming or as a PC monitor
Reviews.Author: Wilder
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Xbox 360 and its great. Does the job.Its thin, runs cool, good picture quality.Sound is kind of iffy but I use headphones.I wouldn't buy this if you are looking for just a TV. This thing is strictly a gaming tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: robert durant
Reviews.Content: ViewSonic VT2300LED 23-Inch 1920x1080p LED LCD HDTV with Built-in HDTV Tuner, BlackWe had to replace our bedroom TV and got this one , we just love it !! a Beautiful picture very clear ,and looks great on the dresser ,so very happy with it :-)

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: NC-kiwi
Reviews.Content: Great buy. Awesome picture & the sound quality is would you would expect from a TV/Monitor.Amazon is fast becoming my "go to" shop.

Reviews.Title: excellent picture
Reviews.Author: D. Maziuk
Reviews.Content: Pros: best SD picture I've seen on an lcd screen.HD, aka "native", aka "optimal" resolution looks good on them, unless it's a really cheap junk lcd -- and ViewSonic doesn't usually sell those. It's the low res when you begin to see sharp edges and staircase gradients. On this screen they're still visible in certain scenes, e.g. screen full of bluish mist, but 99% of the time I don't see them. Way better then other lcd screens I looked at.Cons: have to press Zoom button all the time. It does not auto-adjust the picture to hdtv signal.Re: sound -- it's not tinny, it's clipping at the top end if you have surround on. On the soundtracks with lots of high hissing and tsking it can get really bad. Turn srs off and turn treble down a few dBs (default setting was +6 on mine). (I suspect the placement may make a difference, too: with sound coming out of the back, if you place the tv close to the wall, sound will reflect right back into the speakers. Mine's in the corner, there's more room behind it and sound isn't reflecting straight back.)Anyway, you have a choice of headphone or digital coax out (no optical, though).

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic VT2300LED
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Susan T. Shaw Burroughs "Tcat2"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this as A TV, have not used it as a monitor and probably won't.  The color is amazing as I have never seen these colors on any TV that I have owned.  The reds are red and I now see yellows, purples, blues, like never before!  On some settings the sound can be tinny as others have stated, but on some settings it is just fine.  I do plan on adding other speakers but for now I can live with it.I think this was a great purchase and I am glad that I took a chance as I was a little hesitant and wanted to see it first and compare it to the rest of the line-up. It is just perfect for any bedroom, kitchen, or office.

Reviews.Title: So crisp and so Clean
Reviews.Author: The Avenger "I Avenge Things"
Reviews.Content: Brilliant picture!Sound could use some improvement but I knew coming in what I should expect in terms of sound. I have no problem with it and I ordered it for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: TV is Great for XBox360 Games
Reviews.Author: M. Valen "ProShopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son to play XBox live video games in his room with, and it works great.  I was worried that it may be too small and not have enough detail since he has been using the 42" Plasma but am very happy to say this is the perfect TV for him.An added benefit was that he was able to easily hook it to his laptop and loves watching movies from it.  It has lots of ports which make it very versatile.  The clarity is nothing short of amazing.One thing we noticed is that you can hear the sound better from the rear of the TV than the front.  I'm not sure why this is, perhaps it was designed to be placed against a wall?  It's not a big deal, just an observation.

Reviews.Title: Viewsonic review
Reviews.Author: Anthony N. D'apice Jr. "Tony"
Reviews.Content: The picture is great and the setup was easy. I like the fact that finally when selecting a channel such as channel 13, it knows that channel 13 is 13.1, something a Sony I have, does not have this feature.The sound is very tinny, I played with the Bass and Treble but could not get it to have that deep sound I have on the Sony.The remote already went bad but Viewsonic was quick to replace it.

Reviews.Title: Bargain LED LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: C. Davis "Bargain Hunter"
Reviews.Content: After careful review of the available LCD TVs, I purchased this one. As I already have a ViewSonic computer monitor (which is still going strong after 10 years), I didn't have to wonder about the brand. The criticisms about the sound quality are valid but attaching inexpensive extension speakers takes care of that problem. The slight delay in response time from the remote control is something I can live with. The picture quality is excellent. The build quality is superior to any other comparable products I've looked at (particularly Vizio.) Considering you're getting cutting edge technology (1080i LED) and a larger than usual screen for the price, I'm very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas F. Cheney
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to replace an old analog TV in my motorhome. It works great and is easy to use. I can't fault it in any way. Plus it only weighs about 16 pounds vs the 60 pound "elephant" it replaced. I used a wall-mount for it in the motorhome and it retracts into the old space occupied by the former TV. It can be adjusted to face any viewer. I would recommend it to anyone with a similar situation.

Reviews.Title: Go for the LED - Less heat, less power, great picture.
Reviews.Author: BargainHunterBooks
Reviews.Content: The "LED" in the name was the key for me.  I looked at other vendors but I wanted to spend around $250.00 and two ViewSonic TVs ended up on the top of my list.  I looked at the ViewSonic VT2430 24-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV and the ViewSonic VT2300LED 23-Inch 1920x1080p LED LCD HDTV and at first I didn't see a whole lot of difference except that the VT2430 was bigger by an inch.  A little more investigation and I paid attention to the "LED" in the VT2300LED title and I'm glad I chose the VT2300 LED over the VT2430.  If you don't know the difference go to your local Wal-Mart (or BestBuy or whatever) and hold your hand in front of a few LCD TV screens and then do the same in front of an LCD screen.  The LED doesn't put off nearly as much heat.The picture quality is very crisp and clear.  Setup was a breeze.  I connected mine to an antenna instead of to a cable feed, did a scan for channels and had all the local channels I could stand in just a few minutes.  The sound was OK, but nothing special.  I would buy the same one again if I needed another TV.

Reviews.Title: New 1080 LCD TV and  Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: Logan
Reviews.Content: The price was great and I purchased this to replace a Sony monitor I had for years. I was going to also use as a TV, in the bedroom office, which are connected.  The Picture quality is great on standard , but not as clear on Theatre mode which fills the screen completely. The connections to my tower and laptop were present, did not need any special cords. The sound was and is amazing.  I connected to small computer speakers initially and was really suprised at the clarity and volumne.  Have now put surround sound in place. It is awesome. What really pleased me was am just using the stand it comes with, (not the wall mount) and it came with it and  was very easy to put together. Should my large screen in the family room ever go down, I would replace it with this brand name.  I am happy and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my bedroom.I wasn't looking for perfect quality since this was just for my bedroom.I was very surprised that the picture quality was excellent and  very reasonably priced.Dont buy this  tv ifyou  want great sound quality but the picture quality makes up for the lack of sound performance.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good Monitor!
Reviews.Author: Exkiezie
Reviews.Content: I have been using this Tv as a Monitor and It does the trick works pretty good I have not hooked It up to the cable yet but I am sure It will be great I would recommend this Tv for anyone looking for dual use with tv and a Monitor. Took the right settings to use this while gaming but It looks nice.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad!
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I found that the TV was easy to set up and had a great picture. And it's nice to get so may more channels. The only problem with getting HD channels is that the remote doesn't recognize,say, channel 72.25, if you were to punch that number in. Other than that, it's a great product and I love it!

Reviews.Title: the best 1080p HDTV for the price
Reviews.Author: ps3 game freak
Reviews.Content: I am not going to make this very long, so in short, this is a great 1080p HDTV for the price (and maybe even a little more). it looks great, and while the sound isn't top notch, its the only problem i found....... go buy it!!!

Reviews.Title: great picture, great price.
Reviews.Author: danny fields
Reviews.Content: i just bought this tv. to replace my home computer monitor but i was so impressed by the clarity and quality that im buying another one to my office, a 1080p tv for 249 dlls. its a great  deal.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Firelight
Reviews.Content: For some time now, I've been juggling several adapters, trying to get my computer monitor to display Wii, PC, DVD, etc. I decided to give this "monitor" a try.  I love this thing.  I can plug anything into it and the picture quality is great.  The video with the VGA plug seemed not as good as my old monitor, but when I switched to the HDMI cable, the quality jumped right up.  Good job Viewsonic, this is a wonderful product.

Reviews.Title: truly frustrated
Reviews.Author: David G. Butler
Reviews.Content: Although I had no problem setting this TV up in our bedroom, I was extremely dissappointed with the sound quality.  Voices and music came through as 'tinny' and not true.My major frustration came when, after only 3 weeks, the audio system was taken over by aliens.  When the set was turned on, the volume was at the highest maximum (enough to drive one out of the room) and efforts to lower it with the remote or on-set controls failed to lower it.  We were able to bring it down a couple of times but the alien then took over and raised it back up immediately.I would strongly urge anyone considering this unit to change course immediately.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture and very easy to setup and configure
Reviews.Author: J. Deluise "Computer Geek"
Reviews.Content: When I recently built a new PC I decided to treat myself to some new monitors as well.  I have a dual monitor PC system (dual output video card), but then my left-hand monitor is also the display for my PS3 and acts as an external display for my laptop via HDMI (obviously I don't use the laptop and PC at the same exact time).  The right-hand display is the extended monitor for the PC and is also connected to my Cable TV.  I was using the VT1900LED previously but decided to try to go a little bigger since I would be using my PS3 with these as well to save some space.Let me start by pointing out these are BIG.  23" doesn't sound much bigger than 19", but on my desk they look massive compared to the old screens (which is a good thing).  They do take up more space than I realized but this is a problem I didn't mind having.  A nice improvement over the VT1900LED by the way is that with this monitor you can adjust the viewing angle about 10-15 degrees up and down which you can't always do with an LED in this size range.First, the input via either HDMI or composite (I tested both) from my PS3 was amazing.  The picture is razor sharp, the blacks are "black" as they should be and the response time is excellent.  When connected via composite I did have to adjust the brightness a bit; it was surprisingly dark at first, but once that adjustment was made, it looked great.  I then connected the cable TV, and again, I was not disappointed.  When first setting up the unit, you have to walk-through a configuration wizard which will also begin scanning your channels to determine which ones you receive.  This is good and bad: The bad is you cannot use the unit until you complete the wizard so you have to make sure if you are going to use a cable/TV connection, connect it before you turn the device on.  Also, on one of the monitors I wasn't even using the tuner but had to wait for the wizard to attempt to scan anyway; there was no way to tell it to "skip" scanning so I had to wait for it to finish. Cable looked very good as well.  Hard to be a good judge here because I was not going through a cable box so my connection was essentially an analog RF connection, but it looked just as crisp as my 32" Flat screen when connected the same way.Last step was to connect the PC.  After reading reviews here I was holding my breathe because I was expecting to possibly be let down.  However, far from it.  I connected my PC using DVI to analog VGA converters to connect to the VT2300's VGA inputs and pretty much right out of the gate everything looked great. Graphics looked fantastic and I started playing a movie and that looked amazing as well, however, I did have an issue with text looking blurry.  I played around with the monitor settings and tried a few things to correct this and nothing seemed to make a difference.  I then ran the "monitor optimization wizard" in the Windows 7 Control Panel and that made a huge difference with text now appearing much sharper.  After that, it looked just as good if not better than a regular monitor.  Curiously, when I connected my laptop via the HDMI port (my laptop has an HDMI out), that step was not necessary.  My laptop looked very sharp from the start.I am doing quite a bit with these monitors/TV's and expected to spend quite a bit of time fine tuning them to meet my needs.  When I turned the first one on and got past the wizard, I marveled at all of the options available for fine tuning the display properties and even discovered there is a way to create "templates" to save the settings you have adjusted to in case you want to go back and forth or switch settings for different uses/applications etc..  None of that was necessary and I wound up spending very little time in the menus making adjustments.  In fact, I am pretty sure I spent far more time in the menu trying to figure out how to adjust for Daylight Savings Time than I did trying to adjust picture quality.Last thing worth mentioning is sound/audio quality.  I generally have the sound down kind of low because these are used in a home office.  With that being said,  the sound appears "decent" to me.  The speakers are small though and like most Flat Screens in this size range, to keep the bezel size down, they mount the speakers just behind the screen and point them down.  Not an optimal configuration if you are an audiophile.  The monitor I have as the 2nd PC I only have cable TV coming out which is usually a background thing for me anyway so the sound is fine as is.  For the other display however, I connected a nice but inexpensive pair of computer speakers to the output and my PS3 and movies sound great.  People have complained about the audio from these in other reviews and for the most part they are right, but even my big living room flat screen is connected to external speakers, so to me I wasn't bothered.  Overall very impressed with the versatility of these screens and the price point made my purchase a home run for me.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Bueno
Reviews.Content: ViewSonic is an great company but unfortunately for this product I need say - bad,bad,bad - worst colors that I saw already for an LED monitor. Basically in some situations you can't see letters. I'll return immediatly and will buy an Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Gavin
Reviews.Content: This TV works great with a HDTV antenna. It's also a good monitor for computers. I love it.

Reviews.Title: pic okay but some problems
Reviews.Author: wayne robert ivey
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of the Viewsonic tv is as good as other tvs in the same price range, I believe.  What I don't like is the following:  (1) the info displayed when the info button is pressed on the remote control is in very small letters (very hard to read) and I have yet to find a way to increase the time that the info is displayed (not enough time to read the info), (2) I checked my favorites on the favorite menu and hid those channels that I wanted hidden on the hide/visible menu, but still snowy analog channel 11 keeps coming up when I want digital channel 11.1, (3) the literature suggests that a multiplexor should be used if a non-digital type antennae is being used, but when I emailed Viewsonic support, I, so far - it has been two weeks, have not received an answer as to what kind of mulitplexor I need.  The most annoying of the deficits is that when I want channel 11.1 and get channel 11, I have to move one up to get channel 11.1 and then the "last" button on the remote won't work for the previous channel.  I should have sent the tv back, but I have had it for a few weeks now, and rather than having to repackage the tv, I will keep it (at least the picture is good), put up with the annoyances, and buy a different brand in the future.  If, sometimes in the future, I get a response from the Viewsonic support person on how to remedy the discrepancies that I have listed, I will be more than happy to change this mostly negative review to a positive one.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: kth46
Reviews.Content: the TV works great. Has lots of inputs of all different kinds. Came very fast. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Functionality
Reviews.Author: J. Allen
Reviews.Content: After hours of trying to configure it to properly work as a monitor, it did not work. Whenconnected to the computer, the viewing screen would appear distorted/out of place/balance and there was no way for me to correct it. If they advertised this to also work as a PC monitor, then it SHOULD ALSO WORK AS A PC monitor.As far as TV function, it was not storing the favorite channels, so you had to do it every time. Sound was fine, i dont know what people expect from it.Ending up spending hours for nothing and returning it back. A device should never-never take hours and hours of expertise to make it work. If I have to go threw it, it will never get two stars. When I pay for something, I expect it to work.

Reviews.Title: No way you can use it as a monitor on Windows 7 64
Reviews.Author: ALex
Reviews.Content: I got this monitor/TV yesterday. I was planning to use this mainly as a monitor, but I am going to return it this morning because the picture quality is terrible. Even at Full HD definition, when the monitor is plugged to my computer everything looks very bad. I tried to look for drivers, and I had no luck. Some drivers are available on Viewsonic website, but they are unsigned, and that makes it impossible to install them on a Windows 7 64 computer. I also tried a few different methods (found online) to install the drivers, but with no luck. That's why I am returning it.One more note: the touch buttons are terrible too, and it forced me to use the remote for even setting up the monitor. I also believe that it does not have an OFF button on the monitor, but I am not 100% sure because after 2 hours spent online to try to find a solution to the driver problem, and after 2 more hours spent playing with the settings, I decided to repack this junk!As other people said, also the audio quality sucks. In other words, stay away from this piece of crap if you want to use it as a monitor.

Reviews.Title: Primera experiencia
Reviews.Author: Marcos
Reviews.Content: Este televisor funciona muy bien, muy buena imagen, el sonido es normal (ni bueno ni malo), el control remoto nunca funcionó. Estoy buscando un control remoto universal que me pueda servir pero parece que es dificil.
